title: What country paid its World War 2 debt to the USA? - Quora
tags: The Economy of the United States of America

response.answer_text: As of 2015, according to CNBC, Finland is the only country to have repaid its World War II Reparation Debt. Other countries are tabulated in the article below.World War II reparations: Who owes what? While only tangentially on point, the following details the general balance of debts owed to the US vs. debts owed by the US. It seems that the US is owed about $3.4b more than it owes. Debts Owed to vs. Debts Owed by the U.S. | TitleMax As for debts specifically owed to the US resulting from loans to allies during WW 2, that issue is hotly debated and will be unlikely to be settled. Ever.

There was no WW2 war debt to the US. The US wrote off a lot of the lend-lease arrangements with Britain when they entered the way, I believe, and otherwise they helped rebuild Europe after WW2 with the Marshall Plan. The whole idea was to prevent another war by getting everyone back on their feet and not burdening anyone with unpayable reparations or war debt.
